overview_of_class: The course provides a survey of leading theories of international trade, in order to help students to acquire the ability to analyze the causes and consequences of international trade and implications of globalization. Then it proceeds with an analysis of various trade-policy instruments.
name: International Trade
title: WCAS ECON 361-0-20 International Trade

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course provides a survey of leading theories of international trade, in order to help students to acquire the ability to analyze the causes and consequences of international trade and implications of globalization. Then it proceeds with an analysis of various trade-policy instruments.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Econ 310-1, 310-2 (recommended) or the permission of the instructor

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two lectures and one TA session per week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two Exams, each counts 50% for the total grade.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: No required textbook; lecture slides and some supplementary reading materials will be posted.

subject: ECON
